page.title: 02THE LANDSCAPE OF HASTINGS
page.content: The landdscape is very hilly. The town is built in two valleys and three hills. The valleys are the Priory valley and the Bourne valley. The hills are the White Rock, the West and East hills. To the north of the town is the Ridge which is the limit of housing and industry. The geology is mainly sedimentary rocks with the hills made of sandstone. The coast is a shingle beach with groynes. These stop the drift of the shingle from west to east. The shingle thus prevents erosion of the promenade behind because it absorbs the energy of the waves. The soils of this area contain high amounts of silt which causes them to be sticky when wet. The most fertile soil develops on Wadhurst clay.
